metadata.title: CVE-2015-8366 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - low
metadata.description:
Array index error in smal_decode_segment function in LibRaw before 0.17.1allows context-dependent attackers to cause memory errors and possiblyexecute arbitrary code via vectors related to indexes.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2015-8366` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libraw-bin - 0.18.2-1
libraw16 - 0.18.2-1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

gimp-ufraw - 0.22-3.1~build0.18.04.1
ufraw - 0.22-3.1~build0.18.04.1
ufraw-batch - 0.22-3.1~build0.18.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: libraw package in esm-infra/bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '0.18.2-1').
ufraw package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '0.22-3.1~build0.18.04.1').
darktable package in esm-apps/bionic is affected and needs fixing.
exactimage package in esm-apps/bionic is affected and needs fixing.
dcraw package in esm-apps/bionic is affected and needs fixing.
rawtherapee package in esm-apps/bionic is affected and needs fixing.
kodi package in esm-apps/bionic is affected and needs fixing.
